byline.original: By MICHAEL WINERIP and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

lead_paragraph: Michael Megginson has been in and out of psychiatric hospitals since the age of 6. Experts believe he does not belong in jail, but there is no agreement about where else he could go.

headline.main: For Mentally Ill Inmates at Rikers Island, a Cycle of Jail and Hospitals

snippet: Michael Megginson has been in and out of psychiatric hospitals since the age of 6. Experts believe he does not belong in jail, but there is no agreement about where else he could go.
abstract: Michael Megginson is among a number of prisoners at Rikers Island jail complex who are mentally ill; Megginson's long history of violence and odd behavior behind bars has some convinced that he does not belong in jail, but few agree on where else he should go; New York City police officers, correction officers and even elected officials like Mayor Bill de Blasio are increasingly vocal about damage that incarceration can do to the mentally ill.
